intro: Cyphostemma odontadenium, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by cylindrical, fleshy fruits. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky areas or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in regions with suitable climates.
